0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• evaluate triglyceride levels carefully prior to initiating treatment
  • Hypertriglyceridemia, Adjunct to diet in adults with triglyceride levels 500 mg/dL or higher: Lovaza(R), 4 capsules (4 g) ORALLY once daily OR 2 capsules (2 g) ORALLY twice daily
  • Hypertriglyceridemia, Adjunct to diet in adults with triglyceride levels 500 mg/dL or higher: Omtryg(TM), 4 capsules (4.8 g) ORALLY once daily OR 2 capsules (2.4 g) ORALLY twice daily

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Hypertriglyceridemia, Adjunct to diet in adults with triglyceride levels 500 mg/dL or higher
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Coronary arteriosclerosis - Hypertriglyceridemia
  • Familial combined hyperlipidemia
  • Heart failure
  • Hyperlipidemia - Hypertriglyceridemia, Triglyceride levels less than 500 mg/dL

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity (eg, anaphylactic reaction) to omega-3-acid esters or any product component

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- symptomatic atrial fibrillation or flutter may recur more often with treatment in patients with paroxysmal or persistent atrial fibrillation, especially during the first 2 to 3 months of therapy
  • Endocrine:
  • -- LDL cholesterol increases have been reported; monitoring recommended
  • Hepatic:
  • -- ALT or AST elevations may occur; monitoring recommended in patients with hepatic impairment
  • Immunologic:
  • -- use caution in patients with known hypersensitivity to fish or shellfish

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Omega-3-acid ethyl esters (Omacor(R)) and Omega-3-acid ethyl esters A (Omtryg(TM)) is a highly purified ethyl ester concentrate of eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA). The mechanism of action is not entirely understood, however, possible mechanisms of action include the inhibition of acyl coenzyme A:1,2-diacylglycerol acyltransferase and increased peroxisomal beta-oxidation in the liver

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Bioavailability, Oral: absorbed as ethyl esters
  • Effect of Food: Increased exposure

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • administer with or without food
  • do not puncture gelatin capsules or allow contents to contact foam plastic cups
  • swallow gelatin capsules whole; do not break open, crush, dissolve, or chew

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• reduction in triglyceride levels indicates efficacy
  • LDL-C levels; periodically during therapy
  • AST and ALT levels; periodically in patients with hepatic impairment

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Oral Capsule, Liquid Filled: 1 GM
  • Lovaza
    Oral Capsule, Liquid Filled: 1 GM

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Warn patient that drug is derived from fish oils. Use caution in patients with fish or shellfish allergies.
  • Side effects may include eructation, dyspepsia, and taste perversion
  • Counsel patient on the importance of maintaining a diet and exercise regimen.
  • Advise patient to swallow capsules whole. Do not break open, crush, dissolve, or chew capsules
  • Encourage patient to take drug with meals.
